definition: door to women's room/gate to palace

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
metropolitan civil service examination (held triennially in spring in imperial times)/Crown Prince's chambers/by extension, the Crown Prince
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)

sentences.english: Hoe in hand she steps through her portal.
sentences.chinese: 手把花锄出绣闱，忍踏落花来复去。

sentences.english: Loath to tread on the blossom as she comes and goes.
sentences.chinese: 手把花锄出绣闱，忍踏落花来复去。
